lexUnit.name: spell.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: write or name the letters that form (a word)

sentence.text: ` Miss Honey gives us a little song about each word and we all sing it together and we learn to spell it in no time .
Find the reason why the pupil spelled the word that way , and there is a chance you can teach him not to .
She does n't know the meaning of the word discretion -- probably ca n't even spell it .
And there was one boss -- well , if he could n't spell your name you 'd had it .
But to show he was independent and a big boy he had lately taken to spelling his name with a small letter : martin .
The odd one out is Hare -- all the others are names of animals spelt backwards .
The first time Flaubert saw his name advertised -- as the author of Madame Bovary , shortly to be serialised in the Revue de Paris -- it was spelt Faubert .
Anyway , the main difficulty in spelling the word ` dictionary " is not the a but the ti that represents the sound more usually spelt sh for lack of any single letter to represent it .
A BOY told by US Vice-President Dan Quayle to spell potato with an E is to report on the Republican Convention for New York radio .
Now he 's overboard for France , and spells his name with a ` c " instead of a ` k " .
Similarly , some feminists spell women as wimmin or womyn to avoid including the element men -- even though that is not the true etymology and indeed , the element is not even pronounced .
Some of the words are correctly spelt , others incorrectly .
She never knew how to make it come out sounding as if she was spelling it with a little ` m " .
Yes , I am a snobby old ratbag , and please spell my second name with an A when you write to complain .
